article_title: If the Plan Doesn’t Fit You, We Will Make You Fit It
article_text:
In “The Slow-Motion Implosion of ObamaCare” (op-ed, Nov. 2), Andy Puzder writes that 6.6 million people chose to pay a penalty fee rather than buy what they perceive to be overpriced insurance. What an insightful story.

The federal government decides that 18 to 34-year-olds who are uninsured and eligible for ObamaCare should subsidize the ever-rising costs of the aging and ill by buying the overpriced product. Of course the belief is that many will do this simply because they are civic-minded. But just in case, a penalty...
